{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3547757,"name":null,"username":"Doubledogdare","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/c89c15/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T00:17:35.487Z","cooked":"

I am trying to program a function to target an april tag, and then push a button to move a couple inches to the left/right after targeting. We use java to program our robot. However, most examples of similar are in C++ and any reliable examples I could find in Java are not what I am looking for. I have a super short deadline on this project and I need help. Does anyone have any idea where I could find a reliable example for what I am trying to do?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T00:17:35.487Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":64.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494271,"topic_slug":"i-cant-find-reliable-aiming-code-for-limelight-in-java","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/i-cant-find-reliable-aiming-code-for-limelight-in-java/494271/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3548120,"name":"Alex","username":"aopalka","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f9ae1b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T12:49:14.641Z","cooked":"

Why are you binding a button to move a couple of inches to the left or right? What is the purpose of that? if its because the apriltag is centered on your limelight? If this is the case then i would highly recommend looking at the documentation on how to input the position of your limelight so that it will offset that position and straighten to where you want it too.

docs.limelightvision.io

3D AprilTags | Limelight Documentation

There are three levels of 3D AprilTag tracking in Limelight OS:

Check both of this threads i explaind a bit how to do it in them and added our code

How to Align Precisely Using Limelight TX with YAGSL? Programming
You can take a look at our code It uses pid to align to the closest tag using tx ty tz with a boolean to choose if you want to align to the right or left pipe
"Squaring" and Aligning Robot with April Tag Programming
Take a look on the post i made here in a similar topic it has an example from our code aligning using the tx tz and rotation https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/how-to-align-precisely-using-limelight-tx-with-yagsl/484918/8?u=kully

Also as im seeing quite a few people having problem aligning with limelight i will work tomorrow on writing an extensive post to explain it better

wrote a better more in depth post of how to align using this way with the limelight you can check it out

From zero to auto align to reef tutorial how to simply auto align to the reef Programming
seen some struggle for teams to auto align to the reef so I wanted to create a tutorial of how to do it. before I begin a I will point out a few things: I will show the simplest way to auto align to the reef this is not the most optimized way to do it but it works really good when tuned well defiantly faster than 99% of drivers. also I will talk about the vision processor side a bit but will focus more on the robot code side. ok first of all to start you will need a way to 3d track april ta…
